p: An EEG is not routinely done on all patients with suspected encephalitis, but is useful to confirm encephalopathy and to exclude possible psychiatric conditions as an alternative reason for associated behavioral changes [ 10]. It is also important to detect seizure activity in subtle or non-convulsive seizures [ 10], because seizure activity has a significant effect on the development of brain edema and worsens coma. A recent study by Mohammad et al. shows that an early EEG is a non-specific marker for encephalitis and has a high sensitivity, as 86% of patients in the study had abnormalities on their first EEG [ 42].
